table.name: COMNCTN_CHAN
table.meta: The medium/implementation mode for the sales channel. It is the means of interaction between the Disney selling agent (person or mechanism) and the Guest, such as Guest Facing. The communication channel participates with the sales channel in a matrix. These are channels that serve the sales through fulfillment. Conceived as a set of five {Contact Center, Internet, GDS/ECM, Guest Facing, IVR}.

column.name: COMNCTN_CHAN_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Communication Channel.

column.name: COMNCTN_CHAN_NM
column.meta: The names of the medium/implementation mode for the sales channel.

column.name: COMNCTN_CHAN_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Communication Channel is introduced to the business

column.name: COMNCTN_CHAN_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Communication Channel is not longer used.

table.name: CTCT_EVT
table.meta: Any type of contact of interest to Disney. At present the primary area of interest in around the booking area of business. Contacts can occur through various communication channels such as phone, Internet or mail. The contact could be in response to an ad, offer or previous contact by Disney or the contact could be initiated by the Guest. Contact Events include (but are not limited to) outbound marketing contacts (such as direct mailings), Guest Inbound Contacts, Guest face to fact contacts (such as complaints), Contact between an Organization and a Cast member and contacts between two cast members.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Contact Event.

column.name: COMNCTN_CHAN_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Communication Channel.

column.name: SLS_CHAN_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Sales Channel.

column.name: CTCT_METH_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the regular manner by which guests contact Disney.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date and time when the contact is initiated.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_END_DT
column.meta: The date and time when the contact is complete.

column.name: DEST_NM
column.meta: The name of a Facility (from Fac Service) when the Facility Type Name = 'Destination'. For example, 'WDW', 'DLR', 'HK'. This is also a synonym for Campus.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_CAPTR_VL
column.meta: The value captured by the system. For example Caller ID.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_PREFR_VL
column.meta: The value entered by the guest. For example, this may be used when the guest is calling from work but would preferred to be called at home.

table.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF
table.meta: The number or value given to the contact event from any system. This includes the CTI number as well as the Conversation ID.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Contact Event.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_NM
column.meta: Defines whether the reservation identification is a EDU, PIN or any other external type.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_VL
column.meta: The number or value given to the guest from any system or by the guest. May include the Self Reported Reservation Number.

column.name: SRC_SYS_NM
column.meta: The name of the application containing the reservation id.

table.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP
table.meta: Classifies the reference values coming in from external systems such as EDU.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_NM
column.meta: Defines whether the reservation identification is a EDU, PIN or any other external type.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the reference type is introduced to the business

column.name: CTCT_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the reference type is no longer used.

table.name: CTCT_EVT_PTY_RL
table.meta: Associates the role an individual or organization plays with an interaction. For example, a Guest (Individual playing role of guest) calls the Contact Center, a Travel Agent (individual playing role of Travel Agent) calls the Contact Center. In the future we may record interactions for an Organization type.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_PTY_RL_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of Contact Event Party Role.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Contact Event.

column.name: RL_ID
column.meta: Definition: A system generated unique identifier for each specific Role.

column.name: PTY_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of either an Individual (Guest, Travel Agent) or an Organization (Travel Agency).

column.name: CTCT_EVT_PTY_NM
column.meta: The first and last name of the caller (Guest, Admin, Travel Agent or the Travel Agency name).

table.name: CTCT_METH_TYP
table.meta: The regular manner by which guests contact Disney. Examples include Phone, Fax, Email, Internal Website. Eventually the list may expand to include Facebook, chat rooms, etc. The method may be a lower level than the Communication Channel.

column.name: CTCT_METH_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the regular manner by which guests contact Disney.

column.name: CTCT_METH_TYP_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Contact Method Type is introduced to the business

column.name: CTCT_METH_TYP_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Contact Method Type is not longer used.

table.name: RL
table.meta: The role an individual, organization, facility plays in a relationship. An individual can be a Guest, A Cast Member, A Prospect, a represenTative of a travel partner or a group company. A organization could be a travel partner or a vendor or a group company. A facility could be a primary facility or a function space.

column.name: RL_ID
column.meta: Definition: A system generated unique identifier for each specific Role.

column.name: RL_NM
column.meta: Definition: This element describes the role that a party can play in a job or transaction. DL 9/10/01 Examples: (Below are some possible values) Contractor Assignment DRC Sales Manager Director Vice-President Sales Agent Sales Manager Sales Associate DRC Team Captain Reservation Agent Reservation Manager Individual Sales Agent National Account Manager National Account Director National Account Vice-President Travel Operations Product Development Inside Sales Coordinator Groups Agent Groups Director Groups Manager Groups Assistant Groups Coordinator Groups Senior Manager DEP Sales Manager Regional Sales Manager Team Leader DRC Reservation Sales Manager Travel Industry Support Manager Support Assistant Travel Partner Support Mother of the Bride Travel Agent Child Guest

column.name: RL_DS
column.meta: A textual narrative that describes the purpose of the role for the business.

column.name: RL_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Role is introduced to the business

column.name: RL_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Role is not longer used.

table.name: SLS_CHAN
table.meta: A means by which a Disney product can be sold. Conceived as a set of four {Consumer Direct, Travel Agency, Groups and Conventions, Wholesale} mechanisms.

column.name: SLS_CHAN_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Sales Channel.

column.name: SLS_CHAN_NM
column.meta: The name of the means by which a Disney product can be sold.

column.name: SLS_CHAN_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Sales Channel is introduced to the business

column.name: SLS_CHAN_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Sales Channel is not longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT
table.meta: Any type of guest or agent interaction with the system that requires a transaction event be captured. Note these may be either automated or manual.

column.name: TXN_EVT_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of a Transaction Event.

column.name: CTCT_EVT_ID
column.meta: A unique sequential numeric identifier for a Contact Event.

table.name: TXN_EVT_CMT
table.meta: As opposed to the more general comment at the Contact Event level, the agent must have the ability to to create free-form text in the form of comments at the specific Interaction level.

column.name: TXN_EVT_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of a Transaction Event.

column.name: TXN_EVT_CMT_TX
column.meta: This area is designated for different types of agents (Guest Services, Travel Agent) to enter free-form comments relating to the guest transactions.

table.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF
table.meta: The number or value given to the guest from any system. Can be a reservation or a shop.

column.name: TXN_EVT_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of a Transaction Event.

column.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classification of reference values coming in from external systems such as Sales Offer, Marketing Offer, Collateral, Reservation.

column.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_VL
column.meta: The number or value given to the guest from any system or by the guest. May include the Self Reported Reservation Number.

column.name: SRC_SYS_NM
column.meta: The name of the application containing the reservation id.

column.name: SLF_RPT_IN
column.meta: This will be set to 'Y' when told to the DRC Agent from a Guest (including CTI), versus, the system looking up the number.

table.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP
table.meta: Classifies the reference values coming in from external systems such as Sales Offer, Marketing Offer, Collateral, Reservation.

column.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classification of reference values coming in from external systems such as Sales Offer, Marketing Offer, Collateral, Reservation.

column.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the type is introduced to the business

column.name: TXN_EVT_EXTNL_REF_TYP_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the type is not longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT_PTY_RL
table.meta: The primary guest for an interaction (reservation).

column.name: TXN_EVT_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of a Transaction Event.

column.name: RL_ID
column.meta: Definition: A system generated unique identifier for each specific Role.

column.name: PTY_ID
column.meta: This could be either an Individual (Guest, Travel Agent) or an Organization (Travel Agency).

column.name: TXN_EVT_PTY_NM
column.meta: The first and last name of the person involved with the Transaction Event.

table.name: TXN_EVT_RSN
table.meta: The reasons and transaction types associated with a given Transaction Event.

column.name: TXN_EVT_ID
column.meta: The unique identifier of a Transaction Event.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_ID
column.meta: Unique identifier for the explanation of an action that occurred on a Shopped Sales Order.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classifcation of the type of transaction such as Room, Ticket, Package.

table.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_ASSC
table.meta: This ties a specific reason to a specific component (Cancelled a Dine res, Booked a Room Res). Currently Dine interactions are out of scope, but in future will include this and much more.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_ID
column.meta: Unique identifier for the explanation of an action that occurred on a Shopped Sales Order.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classifcation of the type of transaction such as Room, Ticket, Package.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_ASSC_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason Value is introduced to the business.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_ASSC_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason Value is no longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_TYP
table.meta: The kind of guest action of not purchasing what Disney offered for sale. For example, No Ticket.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_TYP_NM
column.meta: The designation by which a kind of reason applies to different Transaction Types.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_TYP_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason Type is introduced to the business.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_TYP_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason Type is no longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL
table.meta: Explains or describes the rationales for not booking a Shop Sales Order. For example, Price too high.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_ID
column.meta: Unique identifier for the explanation of an action that occurred on a Shopped Sales Order.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_TYP_NM
column.meta: The designation by which a kind of reason applies to different Transaction Types.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_NM
column.meta: Narrative that explains the rationale for the not booking on an Sales Order., or cancelling an Order, or modifying an Order. As the different types of transaction event types grow, so will this list. (This contains bounded list of values for both codes and text of why a particular component was not booked. Carried over from Siebel's List of Values and merged with DREAMS values).

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason is introduced to the business.

column.name: TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Reason is no longer used.

column.name: PRDF_TXN_EVT_RSN_VL_ID
column.meta: Unique identifier for a pre-defined reason that affects an Order.

table.name: TXN_EVT_TYP
table.meta: A lower level classifcation of the type of transaction such as Room, Ticket, Package.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classifcation of the type of transaction such as Room, Ticket, Package.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Type is introduced to the business.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Type is no longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT_VL
table.meta: This is the lowest level of Interaction (combined with the Type Name). For example, when the Type name is 'Book', this value could be 'Rooms Only', 'Package' or 'Dine'.

column.name: TXN_EVT_TYP_NM
column.meta: The name of the classifcation of the type of transaction such as Room, Ticket, Package.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_CLS_NM
column.meta: This is a higher level classification of the Transaction Event and Value. Used primarily for UI purposes, this allows drill down for dashboard type capabilities. The values include 'Sales', 'Marketing' and 'Guest Service'. For the Passport UI, there will be more custom names for display and mapped by the service/ui.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_STRT_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Value is introduced to the business.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Value is no longer used.

table.name: TXN_EVT_VL_CLS
table.meta: This is a higher level classification of the Transaction Event and Value. Used primarily for UI purposes, this allows drill down for dashboard type capabilities. The values include 'Sales', 'Marketing' and 'Guest Service'. For the Passport UI, there will be more custom names for display and mapped by the service/ui.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_CLS_NM
column.meta: This is a higher level classification of the Transaction Event and Value. Used primarily for UI purposes, this allows drill down for dashboard type capabilities. The values include 'Sales', 'Marketing' and 'Guest Service'. For the Passport UI, there will be more custom names for display and mapped by the service/ui.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_CLS_STRT_DT
column.meta: Effective date a value is entered.

column.name: TXN_EVT_VL_CLS_END_DT
column.meta: The date in which the Transaction Event Value Classification is no longer used.
